subject: RE: [junit] JUnit considered problematic
msgSnippet: Nilesh, With all due respect, it isn t mudslinging.  I appreciate your point of view and am not talking about that.  I am referring to the uneducated,
messageBody:
Nilesh,

With all due respect, it isn't mudslinging. I appreciate your point of
view and am not talking about that. I am referring to the uneducated,
"foolish" remarks he is making. The inane remarks "javainsel" is making
are the background noise, IMO. I am addressing his approach, not the
debate.

BTW: As far as I can tell, no one has said that DBC is competition. In
fact, most of the remarks have been that is quite compatible with the
unit (programmer) testing paradigm!

I apologize for the offensive remarks... I should have chosen my words
more delicately.

=jason

On Thu, 2003-04-03 at 09:55, Thali, Nilesh wrote: Okay, can we desist
from this immature mudslinging? I have no
emotional ties to JUnit and TDD although I use it as far as possible
to write better code - but if there's a complementary paradigm that
can help the code be better, I'd like to hear about it; There are
some people who are constructively debating with "javainsel" and I'd
like to hear that, without this kind of inane background noise.
If this does turn out to be an April fool's joke, I've been truly had.
but DbC and JTest sound interesting to me.
regards,
Nilesh

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jacaetevha@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 03, 2003 8:49 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit considered problematic
>
>
> Okay, after continuing to read the list -- perhaps I was
> wrong. I think
> it must have been the optimist in me... it turns out he really is a
> fool. Perhaps Vladimir is right about "javainsel@...?"
>
> =jason
>
> On Thu, 2003-04-03 at 09:42, Jason Rogers wrote:
>
> > I think we've been had everyone. It just dawned on me that this
>
> >'fool'
> >was writing on April Fool's day.
>
>
